_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The gratification, drawback, and escape: If there were no gratification in the eye …
If the eye had no drawback …
If there were no escape from the eye …
If there were no gratification in the ear …
If the ear had no drawback …
If there were no escape from the ear …
If there were no gratification in the nose …
If the nose had no drawback …
If there were no escape from the nose …
If there were no gratification in the tongue …
If the tongue had no drawback …
If there were no escape from the tongue …
If there were no gratification in the body …
If the body had no drawback …
If there were no escape from the body …
If there were no gratification in the mind …
If the mind had no drawback …
If there were no escape from the mind …
The entities from which sentient beings: this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās
this population with its ascetics and brahmins
The state of mind of sentient beings who: They’ve escaped from this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans
They have a mind free of limits
